rule: If the given word's part of speech can be determined and aligns with one of the part-of-speech tags in the alphabetical list provided, the output must be exactly one of those part-of-speech tags written in uppercase without any additional characters, spaces, or punctuation.
validityText:
The input is a JSON-like structure with "sentence" and "word" keys. The sentence is "Le train arrive à 8 heures.", which is a grammatically valid French sentence. It contains words and a number, but no invalid characters or symbols. The word "train" is a substring of the sentence. It doesn't include any punctuation. The input adheres to all the specifications.

OK
coverageEvalText:
The chatbot output consists of a single word, "NOUN", which is a valid part-of-speech tag listed in the provided description. It adheres to the requirement of returning only the tag and doesn't contain any extraneous information.
OK
